tags: nothing new said but a nice interview nonetheless
also really cool seeing two women in such higher-up jobs
summary: Video: Sky Kids’ Lucy Murphy & Gutsy Animations’ Marika Makaroff - TVKIDS
title: Video: Sky Kids’ Lucy Murphy & Gutsy Animations’ Marika Makaroff - TVKIDS
excerpt: Lucy Murphy, head of kids’ content at Sky, and Marika Makaroff, CEO and creative director at Gutsy Animations who is an executive producer on Moominvalley, talk to World Screen Newsflash about giving new life to the beloved IP.

blog.name: hurry-up-snufkin
blog.title: amber
blog.description: Side blog for moomin-related content 🌷19 | bi | she/her

tags: I have so many thoughts about their relationship but this post is already a mess of word vomit lmao
no one read this it's a mess
summary: If they’re gonna be going with Moomintroll x Snorkmaiden rather than Moomintroll x Snufkin in Moominvalley then I sincerely hope...
body:
If they’re gonna be going with Moomintroll x Snorkmaiden rather than Moomintroll x Snufkin in Moominvalley then I sincerely hope her personality & relationship with Moomintroll is improved in the second season, because I ain’t buying it so far.

Take the episode The Secret of the Hattifatteners, for example. Admittedly, the two do have some cute natural moments, like cuddling together when listening to Moominpappa and some other small moments throughout the episode.

Even their make-believe pirates game is quite cute, although Moomintroll suggests that maybe they’re a little too old for playacting anymore, and he’s right; their relationship needs to have a serious, mature side to it now that they’re growing up.

Also, he’s always complimenting her appearance, but never (or at least hardly ever) her intelligence or bravery. I absolutely LOVE book Snorkmaiden because she’s so clever, and Moomintroll admires that about her so much!! But in Moominvalley he just calls her “beautiful” etc. and a lot of the time he’s saying it bc he knows it’s what she wants to hear (in The Spring Tune she even prompts him to compliment her, asking if her beauty sleep worked).

This also seems to be the reason why he’s always trying to act brave around her & protect her; he believes it’s what’s expected of him as a Knight in Shining Armour to her Damsel in Distress (though we all know she can usually handle herself well & even in the Ghost Story episode he says she likes a fellow who’s in touch with his feelings, yet he still tries to be all “manly” around her). For their relationship to work, they need to stop worrying about living up to fantasy gender roles and stereotypes.

Back to the Hattifatteners episode: Snorkmaiden brings up their future children. This immediately makes Moomintroll freak out & uncomfortable as he stammers & goes back on his initial idea of going on a real adventure; he just wanted to have an exciting experience with a friend, not have a story with a fiancé that he can tell their future children (Steve Box said he’s supposed to be around 15/16 in this series)

On the island, Snorkmaiden is picking flowers to decorate her hair & Moomintroll voices his concerns about this action, saying they’re probably rare. She replies that they’re no use to anyone just sitting in the ground and he says they seemed to be growing there quite happily before they came. This is an example of their clashing opinions on nature; Moomintroll seems to appreciate & enjoy nature more than a snorkmaiden does, much like Snufkin. Snorkmaiden taking the flowers is almost the opposite of Snufkin’s philosophy of not needing material things & believing that everything beautiful he looks at belongs to him since he has its memory in his mind. It is clear Moomintroll’s values line up more with Snufkin’s than with Snorkmaiden’s.

A little later, Moomintroll speedily sets up camp inside a cave and after it’s done Snorkmaiden asks if she can help, to which a slightly peeved Moomintroll replies “not so much now I’ve finished.” Snorkmaiden laughs this off and says “oh, my funny Moomintroll.” holding his arm, yet the tone of his response is very clearly unamused: “yes, well… come on.” He does brighten up and make a joke about the thunder being her belly rumbling (another actually sweet moment between the two), yet it is clear the two can get on each other’s nerves from time to time.

Like when he returns to the cave after searching for the lost Snorkmaiden, only to find that she has been there decorating the entire time. He doesn’t give his opinion on the decor and instead expresses how “unbelievable” he finds it that she has been here safe and sound the entire time he’s been worried about her. She then tells him he’ll have to go out alone in the dark storm to rescue Little My (why can’t she go too???) and she gets annoyed at him for packing so many things (definitely something he’s picked up from his mother) & stalling by reading a poem to her. Again, another instance of one being annoyed at the other.

Later, Moomintroll watches the mysterious & enchanting Hattifatteners’ gathering with Little My. He even puts his arm around her as the lightning strikes, and it’s a very sweet brother-sister moment for the two. This happens whilst Snorkmaiden is crying in the cave; she has missed out on having what could have been a beautiful moment with “her love”.

And on the note of not appreciating nature, as they sail back home, Moomintroll remarks on how wonderful the experience was yet Snorkmaiden disagrees with him, saying she wishes “we’d never gone to that silly island.” I understand that her hair is very precious to her, however couldn’t she mourn for her loss whilst still noting that at least the experience was magical & special? This lack of enjoyment at the wonders of nature & adventure is a trait I don’t believe is compatible with Moomintroll (yes she does enjoy their other adventures but sometimes she ends up caring more about her looks & personal possessions, and I think Moomintroll would prefer to bring Snufkin along on a lot of adventures instead).

Idk maybe I’m being too harsh on her but I’m not the biggest fan of this series’ portrayal of Snorkmaiden. I guess we’ll see what happens in season 2.

Addition: ok I wrote all of that a few days ago, and I’m coming back now after having read more of the comics and tbh them two getting annoyed at each other a lot must have been taken from the comics (which makes a lot of sense since Box has talked about how the series is the most faithful adaptation of the books and comics which i honestly think is not true at all but the point is that they wanted the series to be very close to the original moomins media), where they’re constantly getting in tiffs with each other, usually separating, then eventually finding their way back to one another & reconciling.

This is done humorously in the comedic style of the comics, in a very stereotypical “this is what all couples are like” kinda way, almost in a “look how alike they are to a married couple, but they’re just kids!” kinda way.

This works in the comics, but Moominvalley is going for a more dramatic approach; in interviews the directors call it “cinematic” a lot. So, for me, there is hope in the way they’re presenting Moomintroll & Snufkin’s relationship as a serious important part of the story to focus on whilst presenting Moomintroll & Snorkmaiden’s in a more childish and arguably less important way - the only question is, will they grow out of it and find they can’t be together? Would Moomintroll and Snufkin be able to maintain a long-term relationship with differing needs? Guess we’ll found out next year.
body_abstract: If they’re gonna be going with Moomintroll x Snorkmaiden rather than Moomintroll x Snufkin in Moominvalley then I sincerely hope her personality & relationship with Moomintroll is improved in the second season, because I ain’t buying it so far.

Idk maybe I’m being too harsh on her but I’m not the biggest fan of this series’ portrayal of Snorkmaiden. I guess we’ll see what happens in season 2.

This works in the comics, but Moominvalley is going for a more dramatic approach; in interviews the directors call it “cinematic” a lot. Would Moomintroll and Snufkin be able to maintain a long-term relationship with differing needs? Guess we’ll found out next year.

trail.content_raw:
If they’re gonna be going with Moomintroll x Snorkmaiden rather than Moomintroll x Snufkin in Moominvalley then I sincerely hope her personality & relationship with Moomintroll is improved in the second season, because I ain’t buying it so far.

[[MORE]]

Take the episode The Secret of the Hattifatteners, for example. Admittedly, the two do have some cute natural moments, like cuddling together when listening to Moominpappa and some other small moments throughout the episode.

Even their make-believe pirates game is quite cute, although Moomintroll suggests that maybe they’re a little too old for playacting anymore, and he’s right; their relationship needs to have a serious, mature side to it now that they’re growing up.

Also, he’s always complimenting her appearance, but never (or at least hardly ever) her intelligence or bravery. I absolutely LOVE book Snorkmaiden because she’s so clever, and Moomintroll admires that about her so much!! But in Moominvalley he just calls her “beautiful” etc. and a lot of the time he’s saying it bc he knows it’s what she wants to hear (in The Spring Tune she even prompts him to compliment her, asking if her beauty sleep worked).

This also seems to be the reason why he’s always trying to act brave around her & protect her; he believes it’s what’s expected of him as a Knight in Shining Armour to her Damsel in Distress (though we all know she can usually handle herself well & even in the Ghost Story episode he says she likes a fellow who’s in touch with his feelings, yet he still tries to be all “manly” around her). For their relationship to work, they need to stop worrying about living up to fantasy gender roles and stereotypes.

Back to the Hattifatteners episode: Snorkmaiden brings up their future children. This immediately makes Moomintroll freak out & uncomfortable as he stammers & goes back on his initial idea of going on a real adventure; he just wanted to have an exciting experience with a friend, not have a story with a fiancé that he can tell their future children (Steve Box said he’s supposed to be around 15/16 in this series)

On the island, Snorkmaiden is picking flowers to decorate her hair & Moomintroll voices his concerns about this action, saying they’re probably rare. She replies that they’re no use to anyone just sitting in the ground and he says they seemed to be growing there quite happily before they came. This is an example of their clashing opinions on nature; Moomintroll seems to appreciate & enjoy nature more than a snorkmaiden does, much like Snufkin. Snorkmaiden taking the flowers is almost the opposite of Snufkin’s philosophy of not needing material things & believing that everything beautiful he looks at belongs to him since he has its memory in his mind. It is clear Moomintroll’s values line up more with Snufkin’s than with Snorkmaiden’s.

A little later, Moomintroll speedily sets up camp inside a cave and after it’s done Snorkmaiden asks if she can help, to which a slightly peeved Moomintroll replies “not so much now I’ve finished.” Snorkmaiden laughs this off and says “oh, my funny Moomintroll.” holding his arm, yet the tone of his response is very clearly unamused: “yes, well… come on.” He does brighten up and make a joke about the thunder being her belly rumbling (another actually sweet moment between the two), yet it is clear the two can get on each other’s nerves from time to time.

Like when he returns to the cave after searching for the lost Snorkmaiden, only to find that she has been there decorating the entire time. He doesn’t give his opinion on the decor and instead expresses how “unbelievable” he finds it that she has been here safe and sound the entire time he’s been worried about her. She then tells him he’ll have to go out alone in the dark storm to rescue Little My (why can’t she go too???) and she gets annoyed at him for packing so many things (definitely something he’s picked up from his mother) & stalling by reading a poem to her. Again, another instance of one being annoyed at the other.

Later, Moomintroll watches the mysterious & enchanting Hattifatteners’ gathering with Little My. He even puts his arm around her as the lightning strikes, and it’s a very sweet brother-sister moment for the two. This happens whilst Snorkmaiden is crying in the cave; she has missed out on having what could have been a beautiful moment with “her love”.

And on the note of not appreciating nature, as they sail back home, Moomintroll remarks on how wonderful the experience was yet Snorkmaiden disagrees with him, saying she wishes “we’d never gone to that silly island.” I understand that her hair is very precious to her, however couldn’t she mourn for her loss whilst still noting that at least the experience was magical & special? This lack of enjoyment at the wonders of nature & adventure is a trait I don’t believe is compatible with Moomintroll (yes she does enjoy their other adventures but sometimes she ends up caring more about her looks & personal possessions, and I think Moomintroll would prefer to bring Snufkin along on a lot of adventures instead).

Idk maybe I’m being too harsh on her but I’m not the biggest fan of this series’ portrayal of Snorkmaiden. I guess we’ll see what happens in season 2.

Addition: ok I wrote all of that a few days ago, and I’m coming back now after having read more of the comics and tbh them two getting annoyed at each other a lot must have been taken from the comics (which makes a lot of sense since Box has talked about how the series is the most faithful adaptation of the books and comics which i honestly think is not true at all but the point is that they wanted the series to be very close to the original moomins media), where they’re constantly getting in tiffs with each other, usually separating, then eventually finding their way back to one another & reconciling.

This is done humorously in the comedic style of the comics, in a very stereotypical “this is what all couples are like” kinda way, almost in a “look how alike they are to a married couple, but they’re just kids!” kinda way.

This works in the comics, but Moominvalley is going for a more dramatic approach; in interviews the directors call it “cinematic” a lot. So, for me, there is hope in the way they’re presenting Moomintroll & Snufkin’s relationship as a serious important part of the story to focus on whilst presenting Moomintroll & Snorkmaiden’s in a more childish and arguably less important way - the only question is, will they grow out of it and find they can’t be together? Would Moomintroll and Snufkin be able to maintain a long-term relationship with differing needs? Guess we’ll found out next year.
trail.content:
If they’re gonna be going with Moomintroll x Snorkmaiden rather than Moomintroll x Snufkin in Moominvalley then I sincerely hope her personality & relationship with Moomintroll is improved in the second season, because I ain’t buying it so far.

Take the episode The Secret of the Hattifatteners, for example. Admittedly, the two do have some cute natural moments, like cuddling together when listening to Moominpappa and some other small moments throughout the episode.

Even their make-believe pirates game is quite cute, although Moomintroll suggests that maybe they’re a little too old for playacting anymore, and he’s right; their relationship needs to have a serious, mature side to it now that they’re growing up.

Also, he’s always complimenting her appearance, but never (or at least hardly ever) her intelligence or bravery. I absolutely LOVE book Snorkmaiden because she’s so clever, and Moomintroll admires that about her so much!! But in Moominvalley he just calls her “beautiful” etc. and a lot of the time he’s saying it bc he knows it’s what she wants to hear (in The Spring Tune she even prompts him to compliment her, asking if her beauty sleep worked).

This also seems to be the reason why he’s always trying to act brave around her & protect her; he believes it’s what’s expected of him as a Knight in Shining Armour to her Damsel in Distress (though we all know she can usually handle herself well & even in the Ghost Story episode he says she likes a fellow who’s in touch with his feelings, yet he still tries to be all “manly” around her). For their relationship to work, they need to stop worrying about living up to fantasy gender roles and stereotypes.

Back to the Hattifatteners episode: Snorkmaiden brings up their future children. This immediately makes Moomintroll freak out & uncomfortable as he stammers & goes back on his initial idea of going on a real adventure; he just wanted to have an exciting experience with a friend, not have a story with a fiancé that he can tell their future children (Steve Box said he’s supposed to be around 15/16 in this series)

On the island, Snorkmaiden is picking flowers to decorate her hair & Moomintroll voices his concerns about this action, saying they’re probably rare. She replies that they’re no use to anyone just sitting in the ground and he says they seemed to be growing there quite happily before they came. This is an example of their clashing opinions on nature; Moomintroll seems to appreciate & enjoy nature more than a snorkmaiden does, much like Snufkin. Snorkmaiden taking the flowers is almost the opposite of Snufkin’s philosophy of not needing material things & believing that everything beautiful he looks at belongs to him since he has its memory in his mind. It is clear Moomintroll’s values line up more with Snufkin’s than with Snorkmaiden’s.

A little later, Moomintroll speedily sets up camp inside a cave and after it’s done Snorkmaiden asks if she can help, to which a slightly peeved Moomintroll replies “not so much now I’ve finished.” Snorkmaiden laughs this off and says “oh, my funny Moomintroll.” holding his arm, yet the tone of his response is very clearly unamused: “yes, well… come on.” He does brighten up and make a joke about the thunder being her belly rumbling (another actually sweet moment between the two), yet it is clear the two can get on each other’s nerves from time to time.

Like when he returns to the cave after searching for the lost Snorkmaiden, only to find that she has been there decorating the entire time. He doesn’t give his opinion on the decor and instead expresses how “unbelievable” he finds it that she has been here safe and sound the entire time he’s been worried about her. She then tells him he’ll have to go out alone in the dark storm to rescue Little My (why can’t she go too???) and she gets annoyed at him for packing so many things (definitely something he’s picked up from his mother) & stalling by reading a poem to her. Again, another instance of one being annoyed at the other.

Later, Moomintroll watches the mysterious & enchanting Hattifatteners’ gathering with Little My. He even puts his arm around her as the lightning strikes, and it’s a very sweet brother-sister moment for the two. This happens whilst Snorkmaiden is crying in the cave; she has missed out on having what could have been a beautiful moment with “her love”.

And on the note of not appreciating nature, as they sail back home, Moomintroll remarks on how wonderful the experience was yet Snorkmaiden disagrees with him, saying she wishes “we’d never gone to that silly island.” I understand that her hair is very precious to her, however couldn’t she mourn for her loss whilst still noting that at least the experience was magical & special? This lack of enjoyment at the wonders of nature & adventure is a trait I don’t believe is compatible with Moomintroll (yes she does enjoy their other adventures but sometimes she ends up caring more about her looks & personal possessions, and I think Moomintroll would prefer to bring Snufkin along on a lot of adventures instead).

Idk maybe I’m being too harsh on her but I’m not the biggest fan of this series’ portrayal of Snorkmaiden. I guess we’ll see what happens in season 2.

Addition: ok I wrote all of that a few days ago, and I’m coming back now after having read more of the comics and tbh them two getting annoyed at each other a lot must have been taken from the comics (which makes a lot of sense since Box has talked about how the series is the most faithful adaptation of the books and comics which i honestly think is not true at all but the point is that they wanted the series to be very close to the original moomins media), where they’re constantly getting in tiffs with each other, usually separating, then eventually finding their way back to one another & reconciling.

This is done humorously in the comedic style of the comics, in a very stereotypical “this is what all couples are like” kinda way, almost in a “look how alike they are to a married couple, but they’re just kids!” kinda way.

This works in the comics, but Moominvalley is going for a more dramatic approach; in interviews the directors call it “cinematic” a lot. So, for me, there is hope in the way they’re presenting Moomintroll & Snufkin’s relationship as a serious important part of the story to focus on whilst presenting Moomintroll & Snorkmaiden’s in a more childish and arguably less important way - the only question is, will they grow out of it and find they can’t be together? Would Moomintroll and Snufkin be able to maintain a long-term relationship with differing needs? Guess we’ll found out next year.

blog.name: incorrectmoomin
blog.title: Incorrect Moomin Quotes
blog.description:
➺ quotes for the moomin series

➺ submissions: open | mod(s): little my

➺ please dm or @ our blog if you draw any quotes, we'd love to share them!

summary:
Snufkin: Small creatures are way more vicious. It’s because there’s less room to contain their anger.
The Snork: That’s...
body:
Snufkin: Small creatures are way more vicious. It’s because there’s less room to contain their anger.

The Snork: That’s ridiculous. Name one example of this.

Snorkmaiden: Wasps.

Too-Ticky: Spiders.

Sniff: Terriers.

Moomintroll: Little My.

body:
Just….just listen to him

https://www.instagram.com/p/BzQSB_4nInn/?igshid=1gj7p3tme6k7a

Honestly Edvin Endre is the biggest Snufkin stan and I love hearing him talk about the character. ALSO could you imagine an interview with him and John Chancer (90s Snufkin) and have them just talk about Snufkin and their experience with voicing him???

summary: Chapter Six of Witch’s Garden, Taking Flight, is now up!
title: Chapter Six of Witch’s Garden, Taking Flight, is now up!

blog.name: thefearisoneself
blog.title: You know. Me, Chad of Camelot.
blog.description: Hello! Please call me Jir! While I reblog lots of things my art is all under my Moominvalley tag, please check it out! I'm a 21 year old girl with High functioning Autism from Canada. My current biggest fandom is Moomins with my favourite character being Snufkin. I am also a fan of Wander over Yonder, Star vs the Forces of Evil, Steven Universe, Ducktales, Undertale, Gravity Falls, the Adventure Zone, OK KO and We Bare Bears. If you have any questions or just want to tell me something, go right ahead, don't be afraid to ask! Just please nothing rude.

summary: Now that we have a release date for the second season of Moominvalley, what Moomin stories do you want to see adapted? Is there...
body: Now that we have a release date for the second season of Moominvalley, what Moomin stories do you want to see adapted? Is there anything else you want to see in season 2? Myself, I’d be happy to see a broader focus in Moominvalley S2 than just Moomin and Snufkin. I mean, they’re great, but everyone deserves a chance to shine.

reblog.comment: Now that we have a release date for the second season of Moominvalley, what Moomin stories do you want to see adapted? Is there anything else you want to see in season 2? Myself, I’d be happy to see a broader focus in Moominvalley S2 than just Moomin and Snufkin. I mean, they’re great, but everyone deserves a chance to shine.

trail.content_raw: Now that we have a release date for the second season of Moominvalley, what Moomin stories do you want to see adapted? Is there anything else you want to see in season 2? Myself, I’d be happy to see a broader focus in Moominvalley S2 than just Moomin and Snufkin. I mean, they’re great, but everyone deserves a chance to shine.
trail.content: Now that we have a release date for the second season of Moominvalley, what Moomin stories do you want to see adapted? Is there anything else you want to see in season 2? Myself, I’d be happy to see a broader focus in Moominvalley S2 than just Moomin and Snufkin. I mean, they’re great, but everyone deserves a chance to shine.
